reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: MERO office PMER support for the Regional Programme

description.narrative:
In order to improve programme quality and programme development, and ensure strategic guidance and partners? capacity building, it is of essence to have presence in the countries and support PMER. For this to be successful FCA needs to commit long-term fun ding. Networking and attending coordination, sector and cluster meetings are important and also the key when seeking new funding. Working with the local partners successfully requires working hand in hand throughout the project cycle. The field presence is in line with FCA?s regional strategy, and supporting the strategic goals especially related to programme quality, capacity building, advocacy and relationship building with other organisations/actors as well as broadening the funding base.
The overall ob jective is to improve effectiveness, quality and impact Jordan, Lebanon and IoPT country programmes focusing on the thematic areas, Right to Livelihood, Right to Education and Right to Peace through established field presence.
Expected results: ? Strateg ic and operational planning for the region including programme and project PME and administrative support ? Established a functional working relationship and collaboration with UN agencies, I/NGOs, CBOs and government authorities at regional and country l evel ? New partnership and networking created to broaden the funding base ? Effective coordination of work and cooperation with other aid organisations ? Capacity of local partners strengthened for effective and efficient programme implementation ? Them atic advice is provided to the regional and country programmes and projects ? Effective emergency response/humanitarian aid has been provided during disasters ? Resourcing and staffing of the Regional Office and Programme Countries have been ensured ? Ma nagement and administration of the Regional Office have been further strengthened and support to field presence in programme countries provided ? Input of partner organisations and topics from the region into the lobby and advocacy work have been increased
? Support and input for communication purposes have been ensured
Partners: Local and regional civil society actors, international organisations, government, donors
